page.title: 04Sleights Moor. P1
page.content:
This{upland area}occupies about 700 hectares of the block and extends into more southerly blocks. Dominated by the purple flowering 'ling'{(Calluna {vulgaris),}the open moorland can excite the visitor, feed the sheep, house the wildlife, interest the{ walker, satisfy the sportsman and please or quell the passing motorist.}
{Careful management}reduces conflicts of land use.A careless visitor or walker may start an uncontrolled fire which can destroy the underlying peat as well as the vegetation. (1959). Controlled burning of small areas in autumn encourages vigorous growth of young heather.It is this management which kept the moor for present use. { } (Continued on next page)
